Multiplicative Latent Forces Modules¶

Multiplicative latent force models are a class of non-autonomous ordinary differential equations defined by evolution equations of the form

\[\dot{\mathbf{x}}(t) = \left( \mathbf{A}_0 + \sum_{r=1}^R g_r(t)\mathbf{A}_r\right)\mathbf{x}(t),\]

where \(\{ \mathbf{A}_r \}\) for \(r=0,1,\ldots, R\) are a set of constant “structure matrices” which determine the geometric structure of the space of possible solutions, and the models flexibility arises from the set of latent Gaussian processes \(\{ g_r(t) \}\).

We provide two methods for carrying out inference in this class of methods

  • 1. MLFM Adaptive Gradient Matching
  • 2. MLFM Neumann Series Methods
    • 2.1. Simulation
    • 2.2. EM Estimation
